text: <@U2T8M7PA4> got a few questions about some of the features, mainly what is the closed button on featured announcements used for (or was supposed to be used for) <https://www.drupal.org/project/announce/issues/3249644>

elements.text: got a few questions about some of the features, mainly what is the closed button on featured announcements used for (or was supposed to be used for)

attachments.title: Clarify behavior of announcements, new, viewed, hiding, etc.
attachments.text: Problem/Motivation It is not clear what a user can do with annoucements and what gets saved or not. Currently the list is displayed and cached for each user (using the announce:feed: cache tag, and user cache context). For each user a list of announcements ID is saved and is used to mark annoucements as "new" if an announcement id is not in this list.
attachments.fallback: Drupal.org: Clarify behavior of announcements, new, viewed, hiding, etc.

text: Thanks <@U4PT7ES0M> for fixing up <https://www.drupal.org/project/announce/issues/3249535>, I think this should go in, then I would love to submit more fixes for other things in the same code lines :smile:

attachments.title: Some of configuration keys, cache tags, keyvalue store, service names, logger channel, etc. use old module name
attachments.text: Problem/Motivation The configuration and state keys used in the module still use to the old module name and thus are misleading / incorrect. Steps to reproduce Proposed resolution Remaining tasks User interface changes API changes Data model changes
attachments.fallback: Drupal.org: Some of configuration keys, cache tags, keyvalue store, service names, logger channel, etc. use old module name

text:
<@U21M96DQU>
Based on initial designs <https://www.figma.com/proto/Ws4Gk0ImaripDb4NAlTvCBtZ/Community-Alerts---Desktop--v1?node-id=41%3A485&viewport=-19%2C551%2C0.11556927114725113&scaling=min-zoom|here>, it was a planned feature where we can mark each individual notification as read notifications, close notification etc.
Later we decided to keep those as enhancements because we want to keep basic module ready for 9.3.x release.

For now, close button on `featured announcement` just hides the notification for a while and it will popup again on when we open the modal next time or reload the page.

here

text:
Yes, currently `new` status is global.
It works like:
• whenever someone opens the modal, all the notifications are marked as read.
• When some new notification comes up in future, it will have bell icon
• Again when user opens modal it gets marked as read.

new

status is global.
It works like:
whenever someone opens the modal, all the notifications are marked as read.
When some new notification comes up in future, it will have bell icon
Again when user opens modal it gets marked as read.

But it would make sense that the same group that governs the announcements themselves would be consulted about future feature revisions.

attachments.title: Show error in the UI in case fetching announcements fails
attachments.text: Problem/Motivation At the moment, if fetching announcements fails, the dialog is opened as empty. This is poor UX since the user could assume that there aren't any announcements. Providing easy to understand error messages is often listed as one of the most important UX considerations. Proposed resolution Show error message instead of the list in case fetching announcements fails. Remaining tasks User interface changes API changes Data model changes
attachments.fallback: Drupal.org: Show error in the UI in case fetching announcements fails
